review_title: Magnificently bad, a work of art
review_detailed_main:
The tag 'it's so bad, it's good' is banded around too much but this is one film which truly embodies that sentiment. From a serious cinematic view it's appalling in every category, but at the same time it may be the funniest film ever made because of it. I watched it on recommendation recently and it had me stitches. There's so much to laugh at and so many hilariously stupid sequences that this is required and essential viewing for anyone. Regardless of whether the comedy is intentional or not, it's one of the most entertaining films ever.

p.s If you thought Arnie was bad in the 80's and 90's you should see him here. He's clearly trying his hardest, but he's so bad it makes you wonder if it's deliberate. I've seen slabs of concrete with better acting skills than this.

There is only one reason to see this movie and it is not the wonderful Governor of California...it is the small Jewish sidekick that makes this movie a masterpiece, one for the ages...my man PRETZI!!! That's right, the man is the epitome of the Jewish New Yorker and I have never seen a more lifelike portrayal of one since in a movie. In fact, he does not even need to speak at all. His amazed facial expressions during the scene where Hercules throws the discus and then the javelin are moving and touching. I love when that man opens his mouth in astonishment. It is too bad that he did not make any more substantial films, most likely because he was just fed up with stardom. Pretzi is a film character that will live on throughout the ages and Arnold would not have the fame that he does today without the amazing portrayal of Pretzi by the true Arnie, Arnold Stang.

OK, having only payed one pound for this in a DVD sale, i can safely say i had very low expectations and i had only bought this to watch for a laugh, well me and my mate have never laughed so much in a movie before! Its obvious Arnie could'nt speak barely any English and it just adds to the humour, some of the acting is just appalling the grisly bear fight will stay in my mind forever, the actor in the suit acts more like a gorilla than anything and as soon as Arnie sees the poor bear he begins to beat the crap out of it, well more of a play wrestle than anything then his girlfriends actress trys to faint.... after looking at the camera and screeching some garbage about beating him up. How she became an actress is beyond me. Anyway if you want 90 minutes of unadulterated crap that will make you cry with laughter then check out Hercules in new york!
This movie is epic! Pure unintentional comic gold!!!! So so bad... so bad its good!

I just bought this movie on DVD. I really liked it! It was funny. Im Arie fan so it was to me treasure. I kinda liked more than Arnies other films. It was great movie. Arnolds debut on the screen. Luckily I got both audiotracks on DVd, Theatrical where Arnies voice is dubbed and original not dubbed track. GREAT! I cant imagine why they dubbed Arnolds voice. I understood everything that he said in the movie. So funny movie! This is Arnolds mark in his career, I dontt mean Conan and Terminator, I mean this was ARNIES FIRST MOVIE EVER!If you are Arnie you just must see it! And if you are not, see it anyway, because its so good comedy. How somebody cant like it? Great movie! overall: ****/*****. SEE IT NOW!!!!!

How this missed the Mystery Science Theater 3000 canon I'll never know. Did they want too much for the rights, or did Ahnold want every copy destroyed? But why? Hercules in New York -- aka Hercules Goes Bananas -- is a classic! I don't understand how those who, like me, fall off their chair laughing can give this movie only one or two stars. A flick with this entertainment value should get a high rating, not a low one. I mean, do you not want to share the joy it brings with others? For me this one ranks up there with Plan 9 from Outer Space and Manos Hands of Fate as the best worst movie ever made. Ahnold should feel honored, and he has such a great sense of humor, I doubt he really wants to burn the copies -- I'm sure he showed it to his kids, and it will be passed on to his grandkids and great grandkids. Same with you. Wouldn't you like to see your grandkids's faces -- let's say, as teens, so they can be in on the joke -- when you show them one of your "favorite movies"? Not Apocalypse Now or Sleepless in Seattle, but Hercules Goes Bananas!

OK, let's start with Ahnold. Yes, I think his is his first real dramatic movie, and I use "dramatic" only technically. I mean, this is pre-Conan, and you know what a wonderful actor he was in that. Then there's the voice dubbing. Now, in my copy, the voice has nothing to do with Arnold. (I know others insist it's his.) I hope your copy has this voice, because to hear it coming out of Ahnold's mouth is very, very moving. Then, there's the soundtrack. Bazuki music! What can I say? Then, there's Arnold Stang. Arnold Stang??? Stang was one of the more serviceable comic supporting actors of his day, which by the time he made this was long past. But never mind...to cast Stang as the sidekick reveals to me that the producers really didn't mean to make a serious movie. It's like casting Woody Allen for the part and making him play it straight. The result is beyond bizarre.

What you do, if you're still young enough to have fun being silly, is to find a Friday night or Saturday afternoon and invite you best friends and have brewskies and weed and watch as this thing unfold.

By the way, I took off a point because, after all, it is terrible.

Arnold's föerst movie is a "must-see" for every Arnold fan on the planet.

review_title: Hercules, a son of god-father Zeus is sent from Olympus to earth by an accident. Visiting the earth is his dream by chance and so he enjoys his time there.

My thesis: One of the funniest movies ever! See it!

So Arnold, straight out of the Mr. Universe contests, plays (what else) a god in this 1970 movie, that gives laugh after laugh after laugh. With hysterically clumsy dialogue ("The way you were staring at me, I thought I had a hair out of place or something of the sort", and "Tea- the conventional social drink!"), honking cars in the background of Olympus, and a short-haired Samson (the biblical Samson, who happened to be summoned by the gods), the enjoyment never wanes.

review_title: Fantastic--one of the best bad movies I have seen
review_detailed_main:
This is an amazingly bad movie. It's so bad, it is downright hilarious. My friends and I watched this (knowing full well it would absolutely terrible), and within the first two minutes we knew we had a winner. The opening narration had us rolling on the ground. For a while it was just bad, but then there was the fight with a bear, which had escaped from the zoo. First, you hear on the police report that the bear is a "grizzly," one of the largest and most aggressive bears in the US. When the camera pans over the cage where the bear was held, the sign distinctly says "black bear," a much tamer species. Then we actually see the bear. Or, at least I think we do. It looks more like a small ape with a bear's head. Probably because it's a guy in a really horrible bear suit. Ah-nuld proceeds to lay the smack-down. Hilarious scene. And then there is Hercules' sidekick, a Jewish guy named Arnold Stang, and the most stereotypical Jewish character ever. It's terrible, but ironically funny. What's even more strange is that the director and the producer were both presumably Jewish, and yet they wrote in a ridiculously stereotypical Jew.

This movie jumps into my number one spot of "Movies that are so bad they are great," leaping over "The Scorpion King."

review_title: Make certain you see the ORIGINAL version
review_detailed_main:
The first released version had all of Arnold's lines dubbed! Apparently they thought that his heavy accent wouldn't make it. The only version I've had the luck to see was the ORIGINAL with his voice. It's obvious that they knew he was to be dubbed out from the way he just (boringly) says his lines, no emotion, no feeling, just words.... of course it MIGHT be that he really WAS trying, but <shrug> he just wasn't an actor!

Obviously that's changed now! What a way to start a career, and am I glad he did it! All of his recent movies are GREAT. This one is a good one to see, if just to see really how far he's come!

Keep in mind the era, and don't laugh too hard at the fake fighting. :-)

I guess what i am trying to say is it's fun, it's silly and it's enjoyable. Buy it cheap if you can. 7/10

review_detailed_main:
Listen, this is a very entertaining movie. It's hilarious. I laughed my ass off while watching this stupid but very funny movie. I mean, here we have Hercules (Arnold) with a terrible German accent?!? How funny is that??? :)

Minor spoiler here: The funniest scene to me was when Arnold fights with a bear who is very poorly animated (You can clearly see that the bear (man that wears the costume) is smaller than Arnie !

Nevertheless, I'm a Schwarzenegger fan. I've watched all of his movies and enjoined in single one of them , including this one! Like any other Arnie fan , I strongly recommend for you to watch this movie. I ain't gonna say that this movie is underrated, it's not, but that doesn't mean at all that it's boring , on the contrary , it's very enjoyable to watch! :)

Arnold Schwarzenegger, now the Governor of California, started his illustrious movie career in this film. He was credited as Arnold Strong, because it was suggested that it would be a more suitable name for him.

Hercules in New York is the story of a man born of the gods who travels from Mount Olympus to New York due to his current lack of excitement. He instead finds a female companion and ends up with a rival in the form of a fellow body-builder.

The most important thing to remember when watching this film is that you must not take it seriously. Arnold obviously was still perfecting his use of the English language (some argue that he has yet to do so) and his errors make for the some of the films funniest scenes. The film is supposed to be comedic, as shown by the track and field events, but it's Arnold who makes the film as funny as it is. No film can be so bad it's funny, because laughter is evidence of enjoyment. It's one of those films you love to hate. Definitely one for a rainy day!

LOOK OUT FOR: The boyfriend of Arnold's female companion. He was also the track and field contender and seems to take losing in sport (and perhaps love) pretty well!

LOOK OUT FOR: The bear. Made the film cheaper than you could ever think possible.
I like the bit when he throws the javelin really far

Schwarzenegger is, and probably will always be, the best action hero in the world.

this film, contains: amazingly bad acting random scenes, music, and direction the stupidest story in the world the cheesiest lines you'll ever hear

which is why this film goes down as one of Arnold's greats! Arnold

films are like marmite, you either love them, or hate them, and it doesn't matter what you feel about it, it's always because the films are crap. obviously this isn't enjoyable because of how great a film it actually is, it's because of how bad it is. so, if that kind of thing has the potential to make you laugh, then you will definitely be entertained with this one. but if you simply do not find Arnold like bad films funny, and only like film that are actually good, then you'll be terribly disappointed.

Heh, Heh, Heh:). One of those classic movies that is so bad that you have to watch it again and again. Now we can even see this movie with the original audio track. I can understand what Ahh-Nuld is saying. Why would they need to dub an Oscar deserving performance like that???? I think I'm going to watch again right now!

This is easily one of the best films in the history of cinema. I don't see why we can't have Hercules represent us in the summer Olympics either...based on his very measurable feats of strength, speed and agility in the park, I believe he deserves a spot on the US roster.

I bought this movie on VHS via Amazon.com in 1997, and remember with excitement the day I was able to pick it up...

Iowa City had never seen a shin-dig as big as the one we threw at Mayflower Residence Hall that evening, celebrating the arrival of Arnie as one of the finest actors of our generation. And then J-Bob Peacock asked us to quite down.

Great movie!

review_title: One Of the Most Hilarious "Cheap" Films Ever!
review_detailed_main:
I can't believe how hard I laughed at the "Grizzly Bear" scene, which magically transforms from an "American brown bear" to a "Grizzly bear" (look at the sign at the zoo, then listen to the radio transmission by the police).

The seen where "Herc" fights the bear is so ridiculous, that you just have to laugh! This film is one of the all time best "cheap" films, following in the steps of all the others before it.

I was lucky enough to view this on AMC, where they provided the version where Arnold "Strong" Schwarzenegger ISN'T dubbed.

He got the part of Hercules because his agent told the director of the film that Arnold spoke great English.

If you enjoyed such "classic", dare I say, films like "Santa Clause Conquers the Martians" then you'll love Hercules in New York, which co-stars Arnold Stang as "Pretz" I believe was his name. 5/5 stars on a scale of stupidity at the movies!

BTW: Was that Nikes the "bear" (which looked more like a gorilla costume on Halloween-a bad one, mind you) was wearing?

John Ulmer

review_title: Great movie but do not expect the most professional
Early, raw, excellent version of young Arnold
review_detailed_main:
o you know why Arnold is flexing? Because this is the first ever film starring the then- aspiring bodybuilder Arnold Schwarzenegger. In fact, this is the only thing that he is doing the right way in the whole movie-flexing.arnold is flexing

Arnold's debut motion picture is a raw and hilarious representation of the young version of one of the most successful men in the world.

Schwarzenegger's evident lack of on- screen experience make this movie looks more like a documentary on bodybuilding.

But first things first.

The plot:

Taking place back in 1970 when Arnold is still an adolescent, the movie tells us the story of the powerful gods of Olympus- the home of the Greek Gods.

The plot centers more on the life of Zeus and mostly on his son Hercules (guess from the first time, which Austrian oak took the role).

The young Hercules is spending his glorious but boring adolescence in Olympus- a kingdom far above the clouds among his divine family. One day he decides to disobey his father's will and escapes to earth.

There, he is starting to explore things he has never experienced before- he falls in the trap of love and he struggles to become an undisputed bodybuilding champion.

The cast:

What cast?! Only Arnold is important here. He is also the only known name in the production.

In fact, by the time, he was only a young bodybuilder who was trying to make his way to the Hollywood top, just like many other aspiring actors with a certain amount of self-esteem.

This is a Funny Action Movie because:

Like previously noticed, this is the first Arnold movie ever! He is so inexperienced in acting that you risk to have shortness of breath from laughter while watching the young Austrian desperately trying to be an actor.

Originally, Schwarzenegger's voice was dubbed because he barely spoke English at the time. Later, however, when the DVD version was released, his own voice was included in the movie.

It won't be far from truth to state that once the DVD version of the film was released, it gained international success. It is just my personal opinion here but I believe that it is due to the fact that then, for the first time, the world heard Arnold's legendary and ridiculous Austrian accent. And that changed everything.

The plot is so primitive, the directing so poor and the acting so bad that it hurts. The whole movie is a complete nonsense from the beginning to the very end.

It is like someone decided on Tuesday to make a movie and on Wednesday it was all wrapped up and ready to be on screen.

The cast is disturbingly inappropriate and the acting is pathetic.

But wait!

Isn't it exactly what we are looking for? That's right. That is the whole idea of it.

It is a sick fun and be sure that it is enjoyable. Arnold's accent is terribly hilarious and God forbid, don't watch this movie dubbed!

Just experience Arnold crying out like a five year old retarded child "I am Hercules" a thousand times or "No man is superior to Hercules". The accent, combined with his funny face moves can easily make you go into spasms of laughter.

Make sure that you don't miss the part at the beginning of the movie when he complains to his mighty father Zeus that he is "tired of the zame old zings, the same old facezz".

At this time, you won't be sure if by the end of the movie Hercules will become bodybuilding champion but somehow you feel that he will definitely win the "who got the most ridiculous accent" competition.

The funniest part is when Hercules is walking on the street along with his hot date and spots a bodybuilding competition poster with some tough man on the cover.

He immediately goes angry and jealous. With the blink of an eye, he tears up his tight t-shirt and starts flexing his giant muscles in order to prove to his girlfriend that his is the God of the gym. He moves like a wounded panda. It is truly spectacular to observe.

Another great scene is the scene with the bear. The extraordinary muscular Schwarzenegger takes his girl on a romantic carriage ride. All of a sudden, a bear comes out of nowhere and stands in front of the carriage roaring loud and menacing the lives of the couple in love.

What do you think happens?

Arnold jumps off the carriage and starts a spectacular one on one fight with the bear. I won't put spoilers here. I would just mention that the animal activists might get angry.

During the whole movie Arnold's expressionless gaze and stiff acting are combined with the boring and inappropriate soundtrack, dramatically dull actors and poor directing. The dialogue is also very, very bad.

Conclusion:

Not only this is a must-see movie but if you ask me, it even should be included in your bucket list right after the "parachute diving" check off.

Seriously, this gem perfectly serves its purpose-to distract you, to make you feel good and to make you laugh no matter if you are an Arnold Schwarzenegger fan or not.

www. funny action movies.com

Okay, I first heard about this movie when it was reviewed on Cinematic Excrement, an online show that I enjoy very much. Then one day, I was walking down the aisles of Walgreens when I saw this in their DVD selection. I had no money at the time, so I didn't get it. Then, in May, I was walking down the aisles of Walgreens, but this time, I had four bucks to kill! So instead of blowing it on candy, I blew it on this movie, and it was a four bucks worth blowing. This film is very enjoyably bad. Arnold's acting is very wooden, and I always make fun of the way he says "Hercules". The budget looks very TV movie-Esq. I love Zeus, even though he looks like he really doesn't want to be in this movie. I love how the fight scenes are barely fight scenes, they're either pushing or tossing. The editing is very bad, as well, mainly the scene where Hercules is showing off his "mad" Olympic-like skills. We see him jump, then people with wide-opened mouths, and then Arnold land.

It's a shame that this movie isn't celebrated like the way I do. It should be worshiped for how bad it is, like Plan 9 or Manos. I say, whenever there's a new movie about Herc coming on TV or to theaters, forget that and pop in this flick!

review_title: I hate Schwarzenegger, but I like this movie.
review_detailed_main:
I am not the kind of person who enjoys Arnold Schwarzenegger movies. I find them rather annoying, and I wonder what society has come to when a man with the all-around ineptitude of Schwarzenegger gains the demigodhood moviegoers have known him for. "Hercules in New York" is an exception. Not because it's a good movie--it's definitely horrible. But it does have an unintended laughter quality that redeems it.

It's common knowledge that this is Ah-nold's first movie. Fresh off his bodybuilding days but pre-steroid abuse (you can tell these things by looking at him), he is Hercules, half-mortal and half-god son of Zeus, king of the Olympian gods. Well, kinda. There's a crapload of stuff taken from other myths as well. Anyway, Hercules has lived on Mt. Olympus for thousands of years, and is bored. So against Zeus' wishes, he goes down to Earth to have some fun.

By now, you gotta be thinking, "what a stupid plot." True. The acting is also mostly, but totally, bad. There's also really bad dialog. And the action scenes look like a the writer based them off a playing session two children had with action figures.

But that's the charm. You'll laugh throughout the movie, particularly young Arnold's miserable attempts at acting. It's the kind of movie that you'll laugh at, make fun of, and have a howling good time watching. Particularly when Arnold is driving a chariot and wrestling an obviously fake bear that moves like a gorilla.

"'Hercules in New York' is the touching tale of an Austrian bodybuilder who thinks he is a Greek demigod. he doesn't fit in, but a little bad dialog and flexing of his body gain him instant adulation."

Yeah, that's the kind of bashing you might give this movie.

So go get a bag of popcorn, a bag of popcorn, and enjoy this movie. Hey, you should; it spawned a video game for the Nintendo Entertainment System. Agh...

Those who have already seen this film automatically know how good this film really is. I would like to let others know how much i would like to stress to you to watch this film.

WARNING:once you have seen this film you will become enlightened and will treasure these moments forever.

Arnie's acting is amazing he acts for toffee (and everyone wants toffee). His word perfect English mixed with understanding about whats actually going on is amazing and keeps the film going.

The incredible costume and expensive settings let alone the intellectual story.... i mean WHY wasn't this film made earlier? What a productive use of money!

THIS IS A MESSAGE GOING OUT TO THE CREATERS OF 'HERCULES IN NEWYORK' AND ALL THAT WAS INVOLVED.....you make me giddy like a little school girl!!!

If it were up to me i would re-release the film on special addition, and attempt to redeem any quality from this film that was once lost.

.....its a MUST NOT SEE

review_title: The greatest Old Movie that has ever existed.

review_detailed_main:
Was Comin' To New Yawk City As Her-cu-les, Ja? This was Auh-nulled Schwarzenegger during his early days.

review_title: Its fantastic. Its Stupendous. Its crap.
Scores highly on So Bad It's Good scale
review_detailed_main:
Arnold Schwarznegger (whom you've heard about) and Arnold Stang (whom you probably haven't heard about) is certainly among the most (unintentionally?) funny comedy duos in film history... Stang manages the most awfully hilarious facial expressions while Schwarznegger has none at all in this early stage of his acting career, giving the no brains only muscle stereotype a (false) play here.

Other highlights:
THE BEAR vs ARNOLD
An incredibly annoying music loop on repeat throughout the film.

review_title: This movie is pure unintentional genius!
review_detailed_main:
I recently bought this on DVD for a heavy price of 1p (Yep, I was well pleased) and it is among the funniest movies I have ever seen! Be amazed at awkward acting taken to the extreme! Gasp at random reaction shots of one of the lamest comic characters ever! Wonder at a man in an ape suit interrupting the most unintentionally funny romantic scene in memory! This is Arnie's first lead role as an actor. And I use the term "Acting" to it's very loosest extent. If your hoping for a quality comedy, your looking in the wrong place. It's cheesy, it's poorly directed, it's sometimes difficult to keep up with what's going on and the "Action" scenes look like they were Choreographed by a six year old. Despite all this movie's shortcomings, you can't help but love it. The director (And Arnie) have clearly tried their best and the results are jaw clenchingly hilarious.

Ed Wood would be proud!
